meanings.definition: Make (someone) less likely to feel shock or distress at scenes of cruelty or suffering by overexposure.
meanings.sent1: After watching scary movies every night, she became desensitized to horror scenes.
meanings.sent2: The constant exposure to violence in video games desensitized him to real-life aggression.
meanings.sent3: He joked that he was so desensitized to horror movies that even a ghost would need to try harder to scare him.
meanings.sent4: Her heart had become desensitized to pain, like a calloused hand that no longer feels the sting.
meanings.sent5: The repeated sound of sirens outside had desensitized her ears, making her oblivious to emergencies.

meanings.sent1: The loud music desensitized the microphone, causing it to pick up less sound.
meanings.sent2: The constant exposure to sunlight had desensitized the paint on the car, making it fade.
meanings.sent3: The repeated use of the detergent had desensitized its cleaning power, leaving stains untouched.
meanings.sent4: The continuous pressing of the button had desensitized its sensitivity, requiring a harder push.
meanings.sent5: The frequent handling of the fabric had desensitized its softness, making it rough to the touch.
